cluster_relations.rel_desc: Nectar that butterflies feed on originates from flowers.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject substance or product is generated or secreted by the object organism or structure.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Pollen is a reproductive material produced by flowers.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is generated or produced by the object entity.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterflies visit flowers to obtain nectar.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an animal visits a plant structure (e.g., flowers), typically for feeding or other resource acquisition.
remarks: Visitation is inferred from feeding, not explicitly stated.
Visitation is inferred from feeding, not explicitly stated.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterflies transfer pollen between flowers during pollination.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an agent moves or carries biological material (e.g., pollen) from one location or organism to another.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Flowers provide nectar as a resource.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject biologically produces or generates the object as a material or resource (e.g., a plant structure producing nectar or pollen).
remarks: Closely related to 'originates_from'; modeled as provision from flower perspective.
Closely related to 'originates_from'; modeled as provision from flower perspective.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Flowers provide pollen that can be transferred between them.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject biologically produces or generates the object as a material or resource (e.g., a plant structure producing nectar or pollen).

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is generated or produced by the object entity.
args.justification: This relation expresses a product–producer direction (nectar produced by flowers). Normalizing the predicate to 'is_produced_by' aligns it with the existing production relation for pollen and keeps a consistent passive-voice naming scheme for product→producer edges. The class and group are retained as they are already appropriate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is generated or produced by the object entity.
args.justification: This relation also encodes a product–producer link (pollen produced by flowers). It already uses 'is_produced_by', so only the relation class is harmonized from the more ad hoc 'production_output_relation' to the shared, more reusable 'biological_production_relation', consistent with other flower→product relations.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is generated or produced by the object entity.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation expresses a product–producer direction (nectar produced by flowers). Normalizing the predicate to 'is_produced_by' aligns it with the existing production relation for pollen and keeps a consistent passive-voice naming scheme for product→producer edges. The class and group are retained as they are already appropriate.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is generated or produced by the object entity.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation also encodes a product–producer link (pollen produced by flowers). It already uses 'is_produced_by', so only the relation class is harmonized from the more ad hoc 'production_output_relation' to the shared, more reusable 'biological_production_relation', consistent with other flower→product relations.
